availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Spilsbee Coleman Owen (Franklin County, Kentucky, student )

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Grandison W. Owen and Margaret A. Owen. Attended school in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Attended school in Franklin County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 31B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 250.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 491A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 137A.
"Death of Mr. S. Coleman Owen, Civil War Veteran," The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, KY), June 22, 1907, p. 7.
"Spilsbee Coleman Owen (1843-1907)," Find a Grave, Memorial 138350618, accessed April 24, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/138350618.
